body_content.explanation: the practice of publishing opinions or comments on the internet, in the media, etc. that appear to come from ordinary members of the public but actually come from a particular company or political group, as a way to make it seem that a product, policy, opinion, etc. is very popular or has a lot of public support:
examples: They were caught astroturfing—promoting the company by using fake online handles and others' email addresses.
He criticized rivals for trying to discredit the results of the poll and denied running an astroturfing campaign.
